Name:
Industrial Automation, Control Systems, SCADA, DDC/PLC Programming Programmer
Save
Description: Job description About Us: Ingenium is a forward-thinking engineering solutions provider specializing in Industrial Automation, Control Systems, SCADA, DDC/PLC programming, and Smart Infrastructure. We work across key industries such as Data Centres, Pharmaceuticals, Healthcare, and Manufacturing, delivering smart, reliable, and scalable automation systems. Position Overview: We are looking for enthusiastic and technically sound candidates to join our engineering team as Programming/Project Engineers. This role is open for experienced professionals with a passion for automation and control systems. As part of our team, you will be involved in real-time projects from day one—learning, contributing, and growing under the mentorship of industry experts. Key Responsibilities: Assist in the design and engineering of automation and control systems. Learn and contribute to PLC/DDC programming and SCADA development. Participate in the setup, calibration, and configuration of field instruments. Support the testing and commissioning of systems at project sites. Prepare and maintain technical documentation and project reports. Gain exposure to control panel design, wiring diagrams, and system architecture. Provide technical support and interact with clients under supervision. Note: Responsibilities will be assigned progressively based on experience and training. Eligibility & Requirements: Educational Qualification: bachelor’s degree in Automation, Instrumentation, Electrical, Mechatronics or Electronics Engineering. Core Competencies: Strong interest in industrial automation and control systems. Effecient understanding of PLC/SCADA systems (training/internship experience is a plus). Familiarity with AutoCAD or similar design tools is desirable. Willingness to learn and work on-site during project execution. Preferred (For Experienced Applicants): Minimum 5+years of experience in PLC/SCADA/HMI systems, especially with Siemens, Allen Bradley, or Schneider Electric platforms. Exposure to HVAC systems, building automation, or power monitoring is advantageous. Other Details: Open to both male and female candidates. Strong communication, problem-solving, and teamwork skills are essential.

Description: Job description Experience: 4-6 yrs Key Responsibilities: Design, development, and field installation of electrical control systems. PLC-based hardware and software development (Siemens & Mitsubishi platforms). End-to-end execution of automation projects, including SPMs (Special Purpose Machines). Hands-on involvement in troubleshooting, commissioning, and optimization of automation systems. Requirements: Proven experience with Siemens and Mitsubishi electrical controls. Strong background in PLC programming, HMI/SCADA development, and control panel design. Practical field experience in installation and commissioning. Exposure to automation systems and SPM projects is essential. Job Types: Full-time, Permanent Pay: ₹30, ₹80,000.00 per month Benefits: Provident Fund Experience: total work: 6 years (Preferred) Work Location: In person

Name:
PLC Programmer
Save
Description: Job description Company Description Dyna4cast Technologies Private Limited is a leading AIoT solutions provider , delivering advanced platforms to Fortune 50+ companies across Asia. With innovation driven by 5th-generation smart sensors, AI-powered analytics, and app-based technology , we enable businesses across manufacturing, automotive, energy, healthcare, and beyond to achieve real-time intelligence and data-driven transformation. Our solutions seamlessly integrate AI with IoT , offering real-time data collection, predictive insights, and high-value applications that bring intelligence and "consciousness" to industrial productivity. By combining Dyna Assist hardware with AI-driven platforms , we empower industries to overcome operational challenges, optimize KPIs, and unlock new levels of efficiency. Join our team to contribute to our AIoT mission and grow your career while shaping the future of connected industries. Role Description This is a full-time on-site role for a PLC Programmer located in Coimbatore. The PLC Programmer will be responsible for designing, programming, and maintaining PLC systems. Day-to-day tasks include developing and troubleshooting automation systems, performing system tests, and ensuring compliance with industry standards. Additionally, the individual will collaborate with other engineers and provide technical support to optimize production processes. Qualifications • Develop, install, and test PLC programs for automation equipment (Siemens, Fanuc, Mitsubishi, and others). • Assist with troubleshooting and resolving faults in control systems onsite for customers. • Collaborate directly with clients to gather requirements, demonstrate processes, and install solutions. • Support system commissioning, field installation, and post-installation technical assistance. • Create and maintain technical documentation for programming, testing, and commissioning. • Ensure high standards of accuracy, safety, and reliability in all deliverables. Requirements • Diploma/Bachelor's degree in Electrical, Mechanical, Automation, or related field; technical certifications a plus. • Experience ranging from freshers to 2 years in PLC programming or industrial automation. • Hands-on skills with one or more PLC brands including Siemens, Fanuc, Mitsubishi (experience in any similar platform is welcome). • Understanding of ladder logic, function blocks, schematic drawing, and logic diagrams. • Ability and willingness to travel for onsite work and operate flexibly according to customer demands. • Excellent communication, teamwork, and problem-solving skills; self-motivated and driven to learn. • Immediate joiners preferred. Benefits • Competitive salary and opportunities for skill development. • Friendly, team-oriented environment committed to excellence, integrity, and client satisfaction. • Exposure to multiple platforms and live projects.

Name:
PLC Engineer
Save
Description: Job description Job Title: PLC Engineer Location: Tiruppur Experience Required: 2–3 years Employment Type: Full-time Job Summary: We are looking for a PLC Engineer with 2–3 years of hands-on experience in industrial automation, specializing in Delta, Omron, Siemens, Mitsubishi, and Schneider PLC systems. The role involves programming, troubleshooting, and commissioning automation equipment to ensure efficient and safe plant operations. Key Responsibilities: Develop, modify, and troubleshoot PLC programs for Delta, Omron, Siemens, Mitsubishi, and Schneider systems. Integrate PLCs with HMI/SCADA and field devices. Conduct on-site installation, commissioning, and testing of automation systems. Perform preventive and breakdown maintenance on PLC-controlled systems. Prepare technical documentation and maintain program backups. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to resolve automation-related issues. Required Skills & Qualifications: Diploma / B.E. / B.Tech in Electrical, Electronics, Instrumentation, or Automation Engineering. 2–3 years of relevant experience in PLC programming and commissioning. Proficiency in industrial communication protocols (Modbus, Profibus, Ethernet/IP, etc.). Strong troubleshooting and analytical skills. Good knowledge of electrical control systems and safety standards. Job Type: Full-time Pay: ₹25, ₹30,000.00 per month Work Location: In person
